verse.roman:
tasyaivaṁ yakṣa-vittasya
cyutasyobhaya-lokataḥ
dharma-kāma-vihīnasya
cukrudhuḥ pañca-bhāginaḥ

synonyms: tasya—at him; evam—in this way; yakṣa-vittasya—who simply kept his wealth without spending it, like the Yakṣas, who guard the treasury of Kuvera; cyutasya—who was deprived; ubhaya—of both; lokataḥ—worlds (this life and the next); dharma—religiosity; kāma—and sense gratification; vihīnasya—lacking; cakrudhuḥ—they became angry; pañca-bhāginaḥ—the deities of the five prescribed household sacrifices.
translation: In this way the presiding deities of the five family sacrifices became angry at the bṛāhmaṇa, who, being niggardly, guarded his wealth like a Yakṣa, who had no good destination either in this world or the next, and who was totally deprived of religiosity and sense enjoyment.
